channel.title: [C4D] Kitchen
channel.description:
Been a while since I've been here lol.
well. I started on a very intensive scene where water flies around obstacles and crashes into things, then drops into a container. but rendering got down to about two frames every 8 hours.
so I made a mini scene where I tested Real Flow physics and launched a ball with a catapult into a bowl of water.
went very fast, but rendering got down to about 12 frames every 8 hours. not too bad.
back to the story. yet again I got sidetracked, and pulled out this old scene. I retextured it, and bumped the settings up quite a bit. rendered in 14 hours. Pretty good I think.
Here's render straight out C4D. [IMG]http://img515.imageshack.us/img515/5130/kitchen1mj9.jpg[/img]
&here's image w/ some post effects [IMG]http://img515.imageshack.us/img515/1037/kitchenxm0.jpg[/img]

item.title: [C4D] Kitchen
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

On second thought, I might redo the postwork one.
It’s not pleasing to my eyes.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Kitchen
item.dc:creator: @Uxalis Uxalis
item.description:
@Uxalis wrote:

Pretty darn good 8/10, although i would agree with teh sharpening, i prefer the first version, lighting looks more realistic.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Kitchen
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Looks good, apart from some lighting.

10/10.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Kitchen
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Ok Bang Train.
I just wanted to get the point across.
thanks for the criticism, now I kinda see what you mean. I took a look at some of mine too. Maybe I should tone it down a few percent and diffuse it?

Bigmac.
I used to be very active here.
Dunno if I’m still on the stats, I was in the top 5 for time here&posts I think it was.
I just took a break from all of this.
I’m not very good at photoshopping, which is why I don’t spend a lot of time here.
but when I finish renders, I usually post them here.
I used to have a thread of all of my decent renders here, but it died very fast.
didn’t seem like people were interested.
&At Mr.Chris(I think that was his name)'s forums, I wrote a few tutorials for C4D.
But I am always here to lend a helping hand for C4D oriented things.
just AIM me= RegularAssNigro.

but bear in mind, I’ve been doing this as a hobby on and off for a year or two.
&before that, I had a tiny bit of experience modeling for the Sims&Sims2
don’t expect to pump out things like this so soon =/

Read full topic

item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

davidude36:

In the middle, in the corner, where the two bottom shelves meet on the floor is a shadow that doesnt make sence

It’s a shadow from the cabinets above it (look where the light source is coming from)

item.title: [C4D] Kitchen
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:12, topic:21387”]Yeah I thought I sharpened it quite a bit =/

&it’s meant to be that reflective.

black appliances are usually pretty reflective.

&&for the planet
XDD
The plain black there was pretty tacky tbh. so I added something there, and stars fit better than any other thing lol.[/quote]

i have black appliances…they dont reflect THAT sharply

and is that mirror behind the cabinets

i just think the scene reflects itself way too much

Read full topic
